title: When did you know that you found your ‘voice’ as a writer? - Quora

response.answer_text: It was a time in my twenties, while I was living a hermit’s existence in the woods, trying to come to terms with several sudden deaths in my family. I took a psychedelic trip, alone in the forest, with a notebook, and words kept pouring out. Later, reading what I’d written I could clearly inhabit the mind and emotional space - a very healing experience. And considering the “voice” I couldn’t help but notice it was nothing like the Earnest Hemingway style that was so popular and strongly considered “correct” at the time. It was flowing, loose, extended sentences more like Faulkner than anyone, I guess. Anyway, I’ve written many ways for many purposes in the 40-odd years since then, but that freewheeling flow remains my “voice.”

After years and years of writing when I didn’t have to think about grammar rules and typos and the words came straight from my brain and onto the paper, and in my voice. Now it happens with everything, even here.
